educational_objective: Diagnose parotid and salivary gland swelling associated with Sjögren disease.
question_text: A 47-year-old woman is evaluated for an 18-month history of dry eyes, dry mouth, and a change in the shape of her face, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is Sjögren disease (Option D). This patient has parotid gland enlargement that is beginning to obscure her ears on frontal view. Nearly 50% of patients with Sjögren disease develop symmetric salivary gland enlargement that is most obvious in the parotid glands but may also involve the submandibular glands.

figures.title: Facial Findings in Sjögren disease
figures.short_title: stem Facial Findings in Sjögren disease
